thread.title: Queen Maxima steps out in a leather skirt in Germany
thread.title_full: Queen Maxima steps out in a leather skirt in Germany | Daily Mail Online

author: Kerry Mcdermott For Mailonline
title: Queen Maxima steps out in a leather skirt in Germany
text:
It's a look more often associated with rock royalty than the real deal.
But Queen Maxima of the Netherlands showed exactly how to work leather into an elegant wardrobe in east Germany today.
The 45-year-old was the picture of refinement in a knee-length plum leather skirt with co-ordinating gloves, clutch and heels as she visited the Bauhaus Dessau with her husband King Willem-Alexander as part of the couple's German state visit.
The Dutch Queen wore her trusty taupe cape over the plum leather pencil skirt today
The Queen smiles alongside her husband King Willem-Alexander at Bauhaus Dessau
The shade was perfectly complemented by her taupe top and the same taupe cape the Queen wore yesterday to visit the European Energy Exchange in Leipzig.
Maxima also gave a glimpse into the size of her hat collection, as she sported another pillbox shaped headpiece virtually identical to the one she wore yesterday.
A dramatic butterfly brooch and coordinating gold earrings completed Maxima's striking winter look.
The smiling Queen waved to well-wishers as she arrived at the design school with her husband, as the couple draw close to the end of their official state visit to Germany.
They also visited Oranienbaum Castle today.
Maxima matched her heels and clutch to her stylish skirt, and wore a hat in her favourite pillbox shape
Step out in style like Queen Maxima in her L.K Bennett heels £115 L.K Bennett Sledge Calf Leather Platform Court
Now sold out - click to buy in a different colour
Buy now
Queen Maxima looked impeccable as she visited the Bauhaus Dessau, teaming a beige tweed top by Natan with a plum-coloured leather skirt for a modern twist.
She then finished off with a camel cover-up and accessorized with a pony skin clutch in a gorgeous claret shade, along with matching heels by L.K. Bennett.
It seems these 'Sledge' heels by L.K Bennett are quite a hit in royal circles as we've seen The Duchess Of Cambridge step out in them many times before. Indeed, she has them in an array of colours!
We love the oxblood shade Queen Maxima has plumped for, which makes a refreshing change from traditional black.
Sadly they've now sold out but there's plenty of other hues still available in this iconic 'Sledge' style (click right). Alternatively, get the look with the similar court shoes below from Dune, Office, La Redoute and Naturalizer.

The Queen waved to well-wishers as she arrived with her husband King Willem-Alexander
The Queen gave royal watchers an insight into the size of her hat collection - today's headpiece was another pillbox shape similar to the one she wore yesterday in Leipzig
The royal couple are part way through an official tour of Germany
Queen Maxima signs a guest book in Dessau-Rosslau in eastern Germany
Queen Maxima accessorised her striking outfit with a gold brooch featuring butterflies
Claudia Perren of the Bauhaus Foundation chats with King Willem-Alexander today
Local children dressed in Dutch costumes wait for the King of Netherlands Willem-Alexander and Queen Maxima
Queen Maxima crouches down to chat to children in traditional Dutch costume in Oranienbaum in eastern Germany
The smiling mother-of-three seemed delighted by the youngsters' appearance
The Queen takes her time to talk to the little girls dressed in Dutch costumes
The children seem delighted to be receiving special attention from Queen Maxima of the Netherlands
Maxima has spent today visiting the castle Oranienbaum and greeting the crowds
As soon as she saw their special outfits, the blonde royal made sure to go out of her way to talk to them
Her face is animated as she leans in to greet a child dressed in Dutch costume in front of Oranienbaum Castle
The children, in white and blue, are wrapped up warm for the wait to meet the queen
The royal couple are pictured greeting the crowds who have been out in the cold hoping to catch a glimpse of them
The queen waves as she departs the crowd and makes her way back towards the car
Queen Maxima looks up as she visits Oranienbaum Castle during her state visit to Germany
Having come in from the cold, the royal removes her gloves and holds them in her hands
King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands speaks next to Queen Maxima of the Netherlands
The couple share a laugh as King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands holds an orange next to Queen Maxima
Queen Maxima was all smiles as she mingled with the crowd and took her time to see everybody
The King of Netherlands Willem-Alexander and Queen Maxima with premier of the German state Saxony-Anhalt Reiner Haseloff greet people as they arrive to Oranienbaum Castle
King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands and Queen Maxima of the Netherlands smile at a workshop at the Bauhaus in Dessau-Rosslach, eastern Germany
